sen.j: 幣原 坦（しではら たん、明治3年9月18日 (旧暦)（1870年10月12日） - 昭和28年（1953年）6月29日）は、日本の歴史家の一覧、教育関係人物一覧。
sen.e: Tan SHIDEHARA (October 12, 1870 - June 29, 1953) was a historian and an education administrator.
sen.cmt: 日本の歴史家の一覧、教育関係人物一覧となっていますが、意味がないので、ウィキペディアから抜粋しました。
sen.e: Tan SHIDEHARA (October 12, 1870 - June 29, 1953) was a historian and an education administrator.
Tan SHIDEHARA (October 12, 1870 - June 29, 1953) was a historian and an education administrator.

sen.j: 大阪府門真市出身。
sen.e: His home town was Kadoma City, Osaka Prefecture.
His home town was Kadoma City, Osaka Prefecture.
His home town was Kadoma City, Osaka Prefecture.

sen.j: 幼名・徳治郎（とくじろう）。
また、名前の「坦」は「たいら」と読まれることもある。
sen.e: And his name "Tan" could be read "Taira".
And his name "Tan" could be read "Taira".
And his name "Tan" could be read "Taira".

tit.cmt: 用語統一リストに従い、修正しました。

sen.j: 山梨県立甲府第一高等学校などを経て、東京大学文科大学国史学科卒業。
sen.e: He studied Japanese history in the department of literature at the University of Tokyo after graduating from the Yamanashi Prefectural Kofu Daiichi High School and other schools.
sen.cmt: 東京大学文科大学-定訳不明
sen.e: Tan studied Japanese history in the department of literature at the University of Tokyo after graduating from the Yamanashi Prefectural Kofu Daiichi High School and other schools.
sen.cmt: トピックがここで変わるので、明確にするために'he'ではなく名前としました。
sen.e: Tan studied Japanese history in the department of literature at the University of Tokyo after graduating from the Yamanashi Prefectural Kofu Daiichi High School and other schools.

sen.j: 東京高等師範学校教授、大韓帝国学部学政参与官、文部省視学官、東大教授を歴任した後1913年（大正2年）広島高等師範学校長となった。
sen.e: He became the principal of the Hiroshima Higher Normal School in 1913, after serving several positions including instructor at Tokyo Higher Normal School, an advisor in the Korean Empire, supervisor in the Ministry of Education, and professor at the University of Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 学部学政-定訳不明 視学官-定訳不明
sen.e: He became the principal of the Hiroshima Higher Normal School in 1913, after serving several positions including an instructor at Tokyo Higher Normal School, an advisor in the Korean Empire, a supervisor in the Ministry of Education, and a professor at the University of Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 抜けていた冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: He became the principal of the Hiroshima Higher Normal School in 1913, after serving several positions including an instructor at Tokyo Higher Normal School, an advisor in the Korean Empire, a supervisor in the Ministry of Education, and a professor at the University of Tokyo.

sen.j: 台北帝国大学の創設に努力し、1928年（昭和3年）同大学初代総長に就任。
sen.e: He diligently worked to establish the Taipei Imperial University and, upon its establishment, was appointed its first president.
He diligently worked to establish the Taipei Imperial University and, upon its establishment, was appointed its first president.
He diligently worked to establish the Taipei Imperial University and, upon its establishment, was appointed its first president.

sen.j: 1942年（昭和17年）興南錬成院初代院長になり敗戦後の1946年（昭和21年）枢密院 (日本)に就任。
sen.e: He became the first director of the Konan Renseiin in 1942 and then became a member of the Japanese Privy Council in 1946.
He became the first director of the Konan Renseiin in 1942 and then became a member of the Japanese Privy Council in 1946.
He became the first director of the Konan Renseiin in 1942 and then became a member of the Japanese Privy Council in 1946.

sen.j: 本職は朝鮮史を専攻する歴史家だが、学者としてよりは官僚、教育者として知られている。
sen.e: His professional studies focused on Korean history, but he was most commonly known as a bureaucrat and an educator.
His professional studies focused on Korean history, but he was most commonly known as a bureaucrat and an educator.
His professional studies focused on Korean history, but he was most commonly known as a bureaucrat and an educator.

sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。

sen.j: 幣原坦の次女・澄江は農学者・古在由直の長男・由正と結婚した。
sen.e: His second daughter, Sumie, was married to Yoshimasa KOZAI who was the oldest son of Yoshinao Kozai, an agronomist.
Tan's second daughter, Sumie, was married to Yoshimasa KOZAI who was the oldest son of Yoshinao KOZAI, an agronomist.
sen.cmt: トピックがここで変わるので、明確にするために'he'ではなく名前としました。また名字を大文字に修正しました。
sen.e: Tan's second daughter, Sumie, was married to Yoshimasa KOZAI who was the oldest son of Yoshinao KOZAI, an agronomist.

sen.j: 天文学者の古在由秀は由正・澄江夫妻の長男であり、坦の孫にあたる。
sen.e: Yoshihide KOZAI, an astronomer, was the oldest son of Yoshimasa and Sumie, and the grandson of Tan SHIDEHARA.
Yoshihide KOZAI, an astronomer, was the oldest son of Yoshimasa and Sumie, and the grandson of Tan SHIDEHARA.
Yoshihide KOZAI, an astronomer, was the oldest son of Yoshimasa and Sumie, and the grandson of Tan SHIDEHARA.

sen.j: 坦の弟は外交官出身の政治家・幣原喜重郎で、喜重郎の妻・雅子は三菱財閥の創始者・岩崎弥太郎の四女である。
sen.e: Tan's younger brother was Kijuro SHIDEHARA, a politician who was a diplomatic, and Kijuro's wife, Masako, was the fourth daughter of Yataro IWASAKI, the founder of Mitsubishi Zaibatsu.

Tan's younger brother was Kijuro SHIDEHARA, a politician who was a diplomatic, and Kijuro's wife, Masako, was the fourth daughter of Yataro IWASAKI, the founder of Mitsubishi Zaibatsu (a financial clique or group, or company syndicate).
sen.cmt: 「財閥」の説明を追加しました。
sen.e: Tan's younger brother was Kijuro SHIDEHARA, a politician who was a diplomatic, and Kijuro's wife, Masako, was the fourth daughter of Yataro IWASAKI, the founder of Mitsubishi Zaibatsu (a financial clique or group, or company syndicate).

sen.j: また、喜重郎・雅子夫妻の長男・道太郎は獨協大学教授を務めた学者である。
sen.e: Michitaro, the oldest son of Kijuro and Masako, was a scholar who served as a professor at Dokkyo Unversity.
Michitaro, the oldest son of Kijuro and Masako, was a scholar who served as a professor at Dokkyo University.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: Michitaro, the oldest son of Kijuro and Masako, was a scholar who served as a professor at Dokkyo University.

sen.j: 幣原家は古在家及び三菱の創業者一族・岩崎家と閨閥によって結ばれているといえる。
sen.e: It can be said that the SHIDEHARA family was connected with both the KOZAI family and the IWASAKI famiy, a ZAIBATSU who established Mitsubishi, by relatives of wives.
It can be said that the SHIDEHARA family was connected with both the KOZAI family and the IWASAKI family, a ZAIBATSU who established Mitsubishi, by relatives of wives.
sen.cmt: スペルミスを修正しました。
sen.e: It can be said that the SHIDEHARA family had kinship ties with both the IWASAKI family--the founders of Mitsubishi--and the KOZAI family.

sen.j: 『南島沿革誌論』冨山房、1899年
『日露間之韓国』博文館、1905年
『韓国政争史』三省堂、1907年
『学校論』同文館、1909年
『世界小観』宝文館、1912年
『植民地教育』同文館、1912年
『満洲観』宝文館、1916年
『朝鮮教育論』六盟館、1919年
『朝鮮史話』冨山房、1924年
『世界の変遷を見る』冨山房、1926年
『南方文化の建設へ』冨山房、1938年
『大東亜の成育』東洋経済新報社、1941年
『興亜の修養』明世堂書店、1941年
『極東文化の交流』関書院、1949年
『文化の建設 幣原坦六十年回想記』吉川弘文館、1953年
sen.e: "Bunkanokensetsu Tan SHIDEHARA 60 years of memoirs", Yoshikawakobunkan, 1953
"Bunkanokensetsu Tan SHIDEHARA 60 years of memoirs", Yoshikawakobunkan, 1953
